CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 6, 1959, pg. 6, 7, reads: "'A Home Show Named Success' must be the appropriate label tagged to the ninth annual Courier Home Service Fair, held at the massive Syria Mosque, last Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday nights. This will be the most talked about 'Fair' ever.  From the opening night when thousands began to gather at the doors, to the final session, when the laughter of prize winners waved emotionally with the disappointed non-winners, the exhibitors and participants worked enthusiastically from their national and local booths to accommodate the happy homemakers.  Beautifully decorated booths, sweet organ music augmented by the 'rock 'em, sock 'em' jazz of Sarah McLawler's combo, set the mood for the huge audiences (4) The Westinghouse local dealer was Forbes Furniture Company.  The booth was manned by Ralph Kalig, owner, and Herb Waldron, Westinghouse district manager.. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Man, possibly Ralph Kalig or Herb Waldron, standing in Forbes Furniture booth with Westinghouse display, at 1959 Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair, Syria Mosque
CatSubject_tab: Signs--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Advertising--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair.Syria Mosque (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.

From the opening night when thousands began to gather at the doors, to the final session, when the laughter of prize winners waved emotionally with the disappointed non-winners, the exhibitors and participants worked enthusiastically from their national and local booths to accommodate the happy homemakers.  Beautifully decorated booths, sweet organ music augmented by the 'rock 'em, sock 'em' jazz of Sarah McLawler's combo, set the mood for the huge audiences (4) The Westinghouse local dealer was Forbes Furniture Company.  The booth was manned by Ralph Kalig, owner, and Herb Waldron, Westinghouse district manager.. - Harris Photos.
